content.text: Given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\), find the inverse matrix \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)
Use your answer to part (i) to solve the simultaneous equations

A cuboid has a square base of side \((2 + \sqrt{3})\mathrm{cm}\) and a volume of \((16 + 9\sqrt{3})\mathrm{cm}^3\) .Without calculator, find the height of the cuboid in the form \((a + b\sqrt{3})\mathrm{cm}\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
The diagram shows a sketch of the curve \(y = a \sin (bx) + c\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\). Find the values of \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\)
the period of f,
the amplitude of f
Given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 5\cos 3x + 1\), for all \(x\), state
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x} (x^2 \ln x)\)
Hence, or otherwise, find \(\int x \ln x \, \mathrm{d}x\)
Solve the equation \(3^{2x} = 1000\), giving your answer to 2 decimal places
\(A \cap B' = (A' \cap B)'\)
\(X \cap Y = X' \cup Y'\)
\((P \cap Q) \cup (Q \cap R) = Q \cap (P \cup R)\)
Q ∩ (P ∪ R)
By shading the Venn diagrams below, investigate whether each of the following statements or false. State your conclusions clearly
Given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = x^{2} - \frac{648}{\sqrt{x}},\) find the value of \(x\) for which \(\mathrm{f}^{\prime \prime}(x) = 0.\)
Write down an expression for \(\overrightarrow{AB}\)
The point \(C\) lies on \(AB\) such that \(\overrightarrow{AC} = \frac{1}{3}\overrightarrow{AB}\)
Find the length of \(\overrightarrow{OC}\)
The point \(D\) lies on \(\overrightarrow{OA}\) such that \(\overrightarrow{DC}\) is parallel to \(\overrightarrow{OB}\)
Find the position vector of \(D\)
Relative to an origin \(O\), the position vectors of the points \(A\) and \(B\) are \(2\mathbf{i} - 3\mathbf{j}\) and \(1\mathbf{i}\) respectively

A particle moves in a straight line so that, \(t\mathrm{s}\) after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its velocity \(v\mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) , is given by \(v = 2t - 11 + \frac{6}{t + 1}\) . Find the acceleration of the particle when it is at instantaneous rest
Solutions to this question by accurate drawing will not be accepted

The diagram shows a trapezium \(ABCD\) with vertices \(A(11, 4)\), \(B(7, 7)\), \(C(-3, 2)\) and \(D\). The side \(AD\) is parallel to \(BC\) and the side \(CD\) is perpendicular to \(BC\). Find the area of the trapezium \(ABCD\)
Show that the length of \(AB\) is approximately \(10.1 \text{cm}\)
Find the perimeter of the shaded region
Find the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle \(ABC\) and a sector \(CBDC\) of a circle with centre \(C\) and radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\). Angle \(ACB = 1\) radian and \(ACD\) is a straight line
Express \(y\) in the form \(a(x + b)^{2} + c\) , where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are integers
Write down the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve
A function f is defined by \(\) f:x\mapsto 2x^{2}-20x+37\(for\) x>k\(. Given that the function\) f^{-1}(x)\(exists,\)
write down the least possible value of \(k\),
sketch the graphs of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) and \(y = \mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) on the axes provided,
obtain an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\)
The equation of a curve is \(y = 2x^{2} - 20x + 37.\)
Find the value of \(p\) and of \(q\)
Find the range of the function g
Sketch the graph of the function on the axes provided
Given that the function h is defined by \(\mathrm{h}:x\mapsto \ln x\) , where \(x > 0\) , solve the equation \(\mathrm{gh}(x) = 12\)
Start your answer to Question 12 here
A function g is defined by \(\) g:x\mapsto 5x^{2}+px+72\(, where\) p\(is a constant. The function can also be written as\) g:x\mapsto 5(x-4)^{2}+q
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
